title: 107_s1210
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE." is a concise statement indicating the beginning of a section with a short title. The Act is titled the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It includes reauthorizations for block grants, federal guarantees, and training and technical assistance under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 extends funding for training, technical assistance, and loan guarantees for Native American housing programs from 1997 through 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a definition of "housing related community development" as any tribally-owned facility or infrastructure that directly aids in the construction of reservation housing. This definition excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4. BLOCK GRANTS AND GRANT REQUIREMENTS. Amends the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5. TREATMENT OF PROGRAM INCOME AND LABOR STANDARDS. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include provisions regarding the utilization of income for housing-related activities. This amendment also addresses restricted access or reduction of income for specific purposes. The amendment to Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 includes provisions on the utilization of income for housing-related activities, as well as addressing restricted access or reduction of income for specific purposes. The amendment also adds a new provision regarding the expenditure of retained program income for housing-related activities. The amendment includes regulations on income utilization and expenditure for housing-related activities. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, including any future amendments. Section 601 is amended to include housing-related community development activities. Feasibility studies are proposed to enhance housing assistance in Native communities. SEC. 8. FEASIBILITY STUDIES TO IMPROVE THE DELIVERY OF HOUSING ASSISTANCE IN NATIVE COMMUNITIES. The Secretary shall conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use housing assistance funds. The Secretary shall conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use housing assistance funds and submit the study to Congress within 1 year. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of a demonstration project allowing Indian tribes to receive housing assistance with tribal authority, to be submitted to Congress within a year. Organizations can receive assistance to maximize tribal authority in Federal housing funding. The Secretary will conduct a study on this within a year to be submitted to Congress. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will conduct a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act. A report with recommendations to address the infestation will be submitted to Congress.
